intro: Angelonia gardneri, commonly known as the summer snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its spikes of tubular, brightly colored flowers that bloom throughout the summer. The plant has upright, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are slightly hairy. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden borders and containers. Angelonia gardneri is known for its long blooming period and low maintenance requirements.
